At that time, the king of the YÄma Heaven, Muá¹£itasmá¹›ti, knowing that the heavenly multitudes had given rise to disgust and detachment, further manifested transformations to increase their disgust and detachment. He transformed heavenly multitudes who played, sang, and danced among the flower petals, which the real heavenly multitudes had never seen before.
Such heavenly multitudes played and enjoyed pleasures of immeasurable kinds and distinctions, in order for the real heavenly multitudes to become free from arrogance.

At that time, the real heavenly multitudes heard the singing and music of the transformed heavenly multitudes, and their minds became ashamed. They stopped singing and dancing, were unable to play, enjoy sensual pleasures, and remained single-mindedly upright, observing the transformed heavenly multitudes.

They saw the transformed heavenly multitudes engaging in immeasurable kinds of singing, dancing, playing, and laughing, with immeasurable distinctions and immeasurable loveliness, without any similarity that could be used as a metaphor.
At that time, the transformed celestial beings in the lotus petals were singing, dancing, and indulging in various pleasures.

At that time, King Muá¹£itasmrti saw that the minds of the real celestial beings had become free from arrogance and well-tamed. He further transformed celestial beings singing and dancing in the lotus petals.

In one petal, the transformed celestial beings were suddenly dropped into the great pond, some sinking deeply and never resurfacing, some bursting out and floating on the water, some like corpses floating on the water, and some embracing each other and sinking together, all crying out:
'Save me, save me!
' They called out to each other.
Some embraced each other and cried out loudly, some embraced each other and then sank.

The real celestial beings on the shore of the great pond watched the transformed celestial beings, seeing the transformed celestial beings retreating, sinking, and being destroyed, giving rise to extreme fear and great sorrow.

At that time, after a lotus leaf fell, another lotus leaf appeared, filled with transformed gods, and also fell into the great pond. Some sank, some with little strength floated on the water and cried out loudly, some sank and were lost, some died and sank under the water, some died and floated on the water like a boat.
Some cried out, some embraced the goddesses and cried out loudly, some were tightly embraced by the goddesses and sank in the water.
Just as in the human world, when a boat breaks in bad water, people all sink.
The transformed gods dwelling in the lotus leaves, along with the leaves, fell into the pure water and sank into the great pond, also like this.
At that time, there was another lotus leaf filled with transformed gods, and it also fell into the great pond, like a stone falling into the water, never to reappear.
At that time, there was another lotus petal with many transformed gods residing within it, which also fell and sank into the great pond, embracing each other and crying out loudly.
Some sank up to their waists, crying out for a long time before finally sinking completely.
In this way, hundreds of thousands of them slowly and peacefully sank into the water of the great pond, like sinking stones, causing the real gods to all see it.
Immeasurable numbers of gods sank and did not emerge.

At that time, there was another lotus petal filled with transformed gods about to fall, crying out with a great voice, like a great mountain collapsing or the earth shaking, or like the sound of the waves of the great ocean.
When the transformed gods fell, they let out a great sound, also like this.

At that time, the real heavenly beings on the other shore heard the voices of the transformed heavenly beings, saw these signs of decline and distress, all gave rise to disgust and aversion, their minds greatly terrified, they circled the pond, observing these transformed heavenly beings, their minds extremely disgusted and averse, and said to each other:
Such things have never been seen before.
There are such great signs of decline and distress among all the heavenly beings, which have never been heard of before, and this great fear has never been seen before.
Having said this, some contemplated and gave rise to extreme disgust and aversion.
At that time, there was another lotus leaf full of heavenly maidens that fell into the great pond, frightened and begging for mercy, crying out:
Save me, save me!
They said to each other:
If the heavenly beings are indulgent, they will suffer such decline, misfortune, and fall into decline.
Having informed each other like this, at that time the real gods' minds became subdued, they all gave rise to disgust, did not indulge in negligence, and their minds became compliant.
Then, the YÄma Heaven King MaudgalyÄyana, seeing that the minds of the real gods were subdued, for the sake of benefiting others, he concealed his own body and entered the lotus flower platform.
Together with the subdued gods who were not negligent, he entered the lotus flower platform, causing the real gods not to see the heavenly king.
The king and the gods, with the best of minds, for the sake of benefiting the heavenly multitudes, all entered the lotus flower platform together.
The remaining real gods did not see his body, and observed the real gods, thinking like this:
'How are those gods to be subdued?
Are they to be free from arrogance?'
At that time, the heavenly king knew that the minds of the heavenly multitudes were well subdued, and even the thoughts in their minds were not negligent, they all gave rise to fear.
'Now is the time to speak the Dharma and gather them in.
Having understood this matter, he further created transformations within the great lotus flower in the great pond to generate fear.
He transformed into a lotus flower with countless petals and transformed celestial beings, who fell into the great pond from the lotus petals.
When they fell into the water, they emitted countless kinds of fearful sounds, and he further transformed into countless celestial beings with corpses strewn about.
The YÄma Heaven King Muá¹£itasmá¹›ti thought to himself:
These celestial beings are extremely frightened and may run to other places.
He then further transformed to prevent them from leaving, and they only watched the transformed celestial beings, becoming increasingly disgusted.
Having created all these various transformations, he entered the flower palace with the celestial beings and observed further.
Having observed everywhere, with the utmost compassionate mind, he emerged from the lotus flower palace in order to benefit the celestial beings.

Together with the celestial hosts, they emerge from the flower platform and immediately withdraw their spiritual powers, causing the transformed events to all disappear. They comfort the celestial hosts, saying these words:
'If the gods are indulgent, they will all suffer these afflictions.
All fears have indulgence as their root;
The gods who are not indulgent are not afraid and do not suffer afflictions.'
At that time, King of the Heaven Muzhouloutuo spoke in verse to the celestial hosts, saying:
The foolish who delight in indulgence always suffer various afflictions;
If one abandons indulgence, one will always attain peace and joy.
All the trees of suffering have indulgence as their root;
Therefore, if one wishes to leave suffering, one should abandon indulgence.
At that time, the true gods saw that the King of the Heaven of Yemo, Muzhouloutuo, was at peace in his mind, and they joyfully rushed to the King of the Heaven of Yemo. They said to each other:
'I have now obtained the lordship of the Heaven of YÄma.
Now sitting on the great lotus platform, surrounded by heavenly beings, able to save and protect me, able to accept and embrace me.'
Having thus discussed among themselves, all of them went to the great lotus flower.
The lion throne where the king of the Heaven of Joy resides and the lotus platform are both the same color. The king of the Heaven of YÄma and the other heavenly beings reside in the lotus platform.
When the heavenly beings arrived, they said to the heavenly king:
'Who caused the heavenly beings to be destroyed like this, to suffer like this, to fall and sink in the water, crying out in distress?
Who is able to inflict such various sufferings on the heavenly beings?'
At that time, the heavenly king Muá¹£itasmá¹›ti said to the heavenly beings:
'This fault of heedlessness definitely exists for all sentient beings.
You heavenly beings have all not yet understood.
At that time, the lord of the gods Muzhou Lou Tuo spoke in verse to the assembly of gods, saying:

All karmic actions, there is no one who can surpass them;ğŸ”½They can cause all worlds

To the future world.

Only the Dharma can save, therefore the Dharma is called salvation.

Life is destroyed by death, so do not delight in negligence.
If good karma is exhausted, one will surely go to the three evil destinies.
Knowing these faults, one should not delight in negligence.
The world belongs to impermanence, all have the thorns of the three poisons,
Because there is birth, there is death, so do not delight in negligence.
Death can destroy life, old age can cause decay,
Sickness can destroy peace and comfort, so do not delight in negligence.
The rope of karma binds sentient beings, the mind relies on the path of the rope-house,
Transmigrating in the three realms of existence, one should not delight in negligence.
Those who are happy will surely experience suffering, for the suffering one, suffering increases,
For the sake of wife and children, one should not delight in negligence.
The mother is also the wife, the wife is also the enemy,
These revolve in their course, one should not delight in negligence.
In the gardens, forests, and valleys, surrounded by celestial maidens,
The world will all come to an end, one should not delight in negligence.
All the heavens experience pleasure, but it will all return to destruction,
False and unreliable, one should not delight in negligence.
All existence is suffering, it is a vessel for old age and death,
One will definitely attain it, one should not delight in negligence.
The faculties are difficult to subdue, there is no one who can subdue them,
All pleasures will come to an end, one should not delight in negligence.
Youth will definitely become old, desires are like a dream,
Therefore, the wise one should not delight in negligence.
Like banana leaves, like lightning that does not remain for long,
All will be destroyed, one should not delight in negligence.
The faculties are difficult to subdue, delighting in the various sense objects,
Only those with wisdom can abide in their own realm.
' In this way, the Heavenly King Musulunda, with the minds of the heavenly multitudes becoming disenchanted, spoke these verses for the benefit of others.
At that time, the Heavenly King Musulunda again spoke to the heavenly multitudes about the faults of indulgence, saying:
'Why do you heavenly multitudes sink in the darkness of indulgence, not seeing great evil, not seeing great fear?
You all see how these heavenly beings, due to indulgence, are all destroyed and return to death, with no one able to save them.
All the heavenly beings' enjoyments surpass yours. Their appearance, size, form, wealth, happiness, radiance, heavenly maidens' singing, dancing, and play are all superior.
You all now see how those heavenly beings, due to indulgence, are all extinguished.
You heavenly multitudes should all contemplate and distance yourselves from indulgence.
Among all the ponds of evil dragons in the world, in the pond of carelessness, the evil dragon of objects is the most extremely evil.
Among all evil winds and fires, the fire of carelessness and the wind of mindfulness are the most extremely evil.
Among all the masses of darkness, accumulated for immeasurable time, accumulated since beginningless time, the mass of darkness of carelessness is the most extremely dark.
Among all the evil enemies seeking opportunities, the great enemy of carelessness seeking the opportunity of objects is the most extremely evil.
Among all sharp swords, the sharp sword of carelessness is the most extremely injurious sword that causes one to fall into the evil realms.
Among all the extremely evil poisonous snakes, the poisonous snake of carelessness, the poison of craving, is able to kill all foolish beings, the most extremely evil poison.
Among all the deceitful enemies pretending to be friendly, the enemy of carelessness pretending to be friendly is the most extremely evil, because it gives rise to all intimacy and affection.
Among all fetters, shackles, chains, and bonds, the fetters of negligence are the strongest, because they are difficult to overcome.
Among all deserts without water, trees, fruits, or shade, where countless beings suffer, the desert of negligence is the most evil.
Because it is devoid of the water of happiness, the trees of good people, and the shade of precepts, it can bring immeasurable suffering to all beings in the world.
Among all unreal and false views, the false view of reality, like a whirling firebrand or a gandharva city,
is the most unreal among the false views in the mirage of negligence.
The pleasures of objects are unstable and fleeting, without true reality, only falsely seen, like a whirling firebrand or a gandharva city.
Among the mirages, negligence is the most unreal and false.
Among all the steep cliffs and falls, the cliff of negligence is the most terrifying, because one will definitely fall into the great evil paths.
You heavenly beings should know!
Thus, all sentient beings included in the five destinies, due to negligence, sentient beings in the three evil paths, due to engaging in evil karma, fall into the great evil paths.
Therefore, all those who fear suffering and distress should diligently abandon negligence with their minds.
This negligence is the root of all suffering.'
At that time, King of the Heaven Muzhouloutuo spoke in verse to the heavenly beings, saying:
Those who are diligent and not negligent attain liberation, while the negligent always suffer.
The characteristics of negligence and diligence have been briefly explained.
In this way, King of the Heaven Muzhouloutuo tamed the heavenly beings and spoke the right path for them.
At that time, the heavenly beings listened single-mindedly and attentively. Because their minds were tamed, they subdued their faculties and their faculties became tranquil.
King of the Heaven of YÄma, MaudgalyÄyana, sitting on a lion seat in the center of a lotus flower, the heavenly multitudes said to the Heavenly King:
'Please tell us what is ultimately beneficial and ultimately blissful, so that we may attain this ultimate benefit and ultimate bliss.
How should we practice?'
At that time, the Heavenly King said to the heavenly multitudes:

'There is a World-Honored Buddha who possesses omniscience, is a teacher of liberation, is liberated from all faults, is fully endowed with all merits, and is the most distinguished among all beings. If one can take refuge in him, one can eliminate your sufferings.
The Buddha is free from negligence. You should take refuge in him. He can save you from the fear of immeasurable and boundless birth and death.'
At that time, the heavenly multitudes, hearing the Heavenly King's teachings, all knelt down - as well as the heavenly maidens - with a respectful and reverent mind, controlling their faculties.
They gave rise to a respectful and reverent mind towards the World-Honored Buddha, joined their palms in reverence, and received the Three Refuges.

All the celestial beings, with a sincere mind, took refuge in the Buddha, took refuge in the Dharma, and took refuge in the Sangha. With a pure and good mind, they despised indulgence and repented with a sincere heart. Seeing the celestial beings' immeasurable kinds of decline and destruction, they were unable to endure the immeasurable suffering and distress.
At that time, the celestial king Muzhou Louta saw that the celestial beings had given rise to a mind of disgust and detachment. He further manifested immeasurable spiritual powers.
In an instant, he was able to manifest one body as a thousand bodies, and within the thousand bodies, he manifested a hundred thousand bodies.
In an instant, within a single form and appearance, he manifested immeasurable various kinds of forms and appearances.
In an instant, he soared into the sky, adorned his body with various wonderful jewels, and wore various kinds of clothing.

In an instant, he disappeared into the water and manifested a thousand heads, adorned with various jeweled crowns and various jeweled seals on his arms, his body's radiance surpassing that of a thousand suns.
In an instant, he transformed into a great mountain, complete with gardens and forests.
In the gardens and forests, surrounded by all the celestial hosts, the celestial hosts all saw him.
Some saw him in a great lotus, surrounded by countless hundreds of thousands of celestial maidens whose bodies emitted light.
At that time, the real celestial hosts were all unable to see the body of the celestial king and the celestial maidens.

At that time, the celestial king Muzhoulouta further manifested spiritual powers, in order to cause the celestial hosts to be free from heedlessness. From his mouth emerged hundreds of thousands of celestial great hosts.

Some were sitting in palaces of the seven treasures, with bodies of various wonderful jewels and lights, wearing various garments, together with celestial maidens, well-adorned and upright, singing celestial songs, surrounding them.

At that time, Muá¹£itasmrti further manifested spiritual powers, emerging from his mouth. Some celestial beings rode on birds of the seven treasures, playing, singing, and making sounds with the five musical instruments, enjoying pleasures together with celestial maidens.

At that time, the heavenly king Musulunda again used his spiritual powers to transform and emerge from his mouth, sitting in the middle of the Kupa tree, playing heavenly music with wonderful sounds, surrounded by heavenly maidens, all drinking heavenly wine, singing, and laughing playfully.
Together with the heavenly maidens, either a hundred, a thousand, or a billion, surrounded by incomparably beautiful and excellent heavenly maidens.

At that time, the real heavenly beings had never seen such an extraordinary event before, and upon seeing it, they all gave rise to a rare state of mind.

'How did these heavenly beings emerge from the mouth of the heavenly king?
It is truly extraordinary!
At that time, the real celestial beings thought like this, discussing together, not knowing what to do.
At that time, King of the Heaven Muzhoulouta manifested spiritual powers again. From his mouth emerged transformed sages with various appearances.

Some had long hair, some had conch-shaped topknots, some wore tree bark clothes, some held water jars in their hands, some wore heavenly garments adorned with flower garlands, and some wore black deerskin robes.
There were such various-colored great sages who emerged from his mouth, either a hundred or a thousand. After emerging, they stayed in the midst of space and spoke a verse, saying:
The minds of all sentient beings are like illusory dharmas that do not abide.
All will surely return to death. Do not be negligent while in existence.
Among all that is lovable, the mind of love grows more and more.
In the end, it will surely return to destruction. Do not be negligent while in existence.
There is no place in existence where birth occurs without cessation.
All pleasures are feared, do not be negligent in existence.
Among all that is seen, the five desires are considered lovely,
But all are like dreams, do not be negligent in existence.
Joy and love are difficult to subdue, always enemies of sentient beings,
Quickly leading one into hell, do not be negligent in existence.
Although one repeatedly experiences sensual pleasures, having obtained them one loses them again,
They will certainly all be destroyed, do not be negligent in existence.
Unwholesome in the beginning, middle, and end, able to destroy the world,
Bound by the chains of karma, like a fish hooked and caught.
Although using various methods, wanting to sever the chains of karma,
Neither gods nor asuras are able to sever the chains of karma.
The chains of birth and death are extremely long, the beginning and end cannot be seen,
This craving is very firm, binding foolish people.
I and the other celestial beings, humans and asuras,
all are impermanent, but the blind of delusion cannot see.
The body of karma pervades everywhere, constantly flowing and turning in various existences,
all are bound by craving, only wisdom can cut them off.
From the water of craving, the five drills and flint are born,
because of the power of the wind of contemplation, one is burned by the fire of time.
Foolish and lacking wisdom, craving for suffering and taking it as false happiness,
confused, one grasps it upside down, flowing and turning in the five paths.
Delighting in wife and children, and various kinds of wealth and happiness,
always cherishing this false happiness, one is taken away by the king of death.
Just as tigers and wolves kill deer, harming them without tiring,
the king of death has great power, killing and harming in the same way.
In all existences, there are immeasurable and numerous sufferings,
Yet due to being deluded by ignorance, the mind is not weary.
If a person relies on evil, it is not called self-love of the body,
Since one does not love one's own body, what else in the world is loved?

Thus, the transformed sage who emerged from the mouth of King Muzhoulou of the Heaven of the Thirty-three spoke these verses for the sake of the real heavenly beings, to remove their arrogance and conceit, and to ultimately benefit them.
At that time, King Muzhoulou further benefited them through spiritual transformations. From his chest, he manifested and emerged a great lotus pond, which was extremely delightful.

Supreme and excellent, like Åšakra, the heavenly king of the Heaven of the Thirty-three, there are hundreds of thousands of such transformed kings.

From his navel emerged a great lotus flower, a hundred yojanas wide, with hundreds of thousands of millions of petals.
There are lotus flowers of the seven treasures with leaves of various jewels, and many bees sing and dance. Hearing this, one's mind is delighted, and seeing it, one loves it.

In the great lotus flower there are transformed people, whose bodies are adorned with various garments, with the utmost supreme bliss, holding plows to plow the ground, and speak a verse, saying:
All those who plow the fields, their minds all hope for the fruits,
Because the deluded mind hopes for profit, they are unaware of the death that will come.
The deluded one's mind of hoping for profit constantly increases in every thought,
But they are unaware that all conditioned things return to extinction in every thought.
When the punishment of old age is about to arrive, it can cause youth to end,
When the suffering of illness comes, it can destroy peace and comfort.

Gods, dragons, asuras, gandharvas, kinnaras,
RÄká¹£asas, piÅ›Äcas, all are destroyed by old age and death.

Grandchildren and great-grandchildren, such seeds and so forth;
People are deceived by love, and all will be lost.
' Thus, the transformed person benefits others and speaks such verses.
At that time, the real heavenly beings, having heard these verses, contemplate them in their minds and do not enjoy the objects of the senses very much.

At that time, the heavenly king Musulunda again created manifestations for the benefit of the heavenly beings. From all parts of his body, various adornments, various appearances, various jeweled crowns, innumerable colors, innumerable shapes, and innumerable characteristics emerged.

There were also various dragons, adorned in various ways, with one head, two heads, up to seven heads, with various colors and various appearances, their heads adorned with excellent and wonderful jeweled crowns, singing and playing in various sounds, giving rise to a joyful mind, and enjoying themselves with pleasure.

The first adornment.
The asura maidens surround and attend to him, and the sounds of the five types of music are delightful to hear;
The asura king resides in his palace, having emerged from the body of the deva king VaiÅ›ravaá¹‡a, and experiences the foremost bliss.

Moreover, he also transforms and manifests the people of Uttarakuru, who reside in the ten great mountains such as MegharÄja, enjoying wealth and happiness, slightly less than the second thirty-three heavens.
In the gardens, forests, and flower ponds, there are many kinds of food and drink, and rivers, and various singing, dancing, and games, enjoying pleasures.
From the body of the heavenly king Musulunda, it emerges again and transforms into the people of Aparagodaniya, self-enjoyment accomplished, joyfully playing, also like this.
At that time, the real heavenly multitudes see such immeasurable kinds and immeasurable distinctions.
The heavenly king of the YÄma Heaven accomplishes such a first kind of spiritual power, in order to remove arrogance and for the sake of supreme benefit, creating such transformations.
It is not without benefit.
It causes the arrogant gods to presently see impermanence, and their minds then become pliable. Therefore, it manifests transformations with various perfections.
First, it shows the taste of desire, and later it shows its faults, causing them to become disgusted with desire.
For this reason, the heavenly king of the YÄma Heaven shows the real heavenly multitudes the taste of desire.

Experiencing various pleasures, singing and dancing, playing, clothing and adornments, food and drink, concubines, intimacy and offerings, the five faculties experiencing pleasure, obtaining all according to one's thoughts, this is called the taste of desire.
What are the faults of desire?

Having obtained desire, the mind gives rise to fondness, seeking but not obtaining, shared with others, not exclusively belonging to oneself, the suffering of separation from what is loved, immeasurable kinds of suffering, being invaded and robbed by those with great strength.
There are also five kinds of powerful ones who can take it away, namely kings, thieves, water, fire, and enemies.

There are also other sufferings, always being invaded by enemies, always fearing being robbed by others, the fear of guarding, or the sorrow and death of the mind, greed and pleasure, the body and mind always suffering.
Such faults of desire will eventually lead to death, with immeasurable kinds of decline and suffering.
Foolish people do not give rise to disgust towards the decline and suffering of desire.
What are the further faults of desire?
Because of desire, mothers and children fight, live in different places, all due to the causes and conditions of desire.
If brothers fight and hate each other, beating or binding each other, all is due to the causes and conditions of desire, this is the fault of desire.

If kings fight over countless lands, attacking each other, beating or binding each other, killing or harming each other, inflicting various sufferings, all is due to the causes and conditions of desire, this is the fault of desire.
Therefore, you should know:
All are bound by desire, all are in the cycle of birth and death.

At that time, King of the Heaven Muzhouluo transformed into such countless different kinds of faults of desire among humans for the real heavenly beings, the faults of kings fighting in countless ways;

and other people, due to the causes of desire, enter the ocean, either fighting together, bound or fettered, with sorrow, lamentation, suffering, and distress, fearing harmful disputes, all of which are caused by desire.
All among humans are unable to attain peace due to the faults of desire.
How is it that in the heavens, due to the faults of desire?
Namely, the gods fighting and destroying each other with the asuras, all of which is caused by the causes of desire.
If the asuras fight and quarrel with the gods, it is also like this.
Due to the causes of desire, there are such things, which are the faults of desire.
For this reason, the night-shining god of the Heaven of YÄma, in order to eliminate the negligence of the real gods, manifests such transformations.
If the dragons fight with each other, their country is destroyed, and there are thunder, hail, and rain, all of which is caused by the causes of desire.
If animals fight, kill, or capture each other, it is all due to the causes and conditions of desire. This is called the fault of desire.

Among ghosts, due to the causes and conditions of food or desire, they beat each other, stab each other with knives, and all of it is due to the causes and conditions of desire. This is the fault of desire.
For these causes and conditions, the king of the Heaven of YÄma, in order to eliminate the carelessness of the real gods, manifests such transformations.
In the hells, they burn each other, beat each other, kill each other, and experience various sufferings.

When among humans, due to the causes and conditions of desire, they create evil karma, fight, and are jealous. Because of the causes and conditions of their past attachments to women, they are jealous of each other. Because of this evil karma, they fall into the hells and their bodies are torn apart.
Such hells are all due to the faults of desire.

For this reason, the king of the Heaven of YÄma, in order to cause the real gods to abandon desire, manifests such transformations, pervading the five realms, showing the faults of desire, causing them to detest birth and death, and showing that all the flavors of desire in the human realm are lost.

The king of the Heaven of YÄma, in order to show the gods the flavors and faults of desire, transforms a lotus flower with a hundred petals that falls, breaks, decays, and disappears, and further extensively shows the faults of gods and humans.
Having shown the faults, he further shows the seeds of liberation and escape, in order to benefit and comfort the multitudes of gods.
The king of the Heaven of YÄma, in order to benefit the multitudes of gods, further shows the faults of desire.
Why is this?
Hearing of the faults of different desires, one then gives rise to a mind of disgust towards birth and death, due to seeing them as different.
